title: Cyrell Paule and Eden Dally hit back at fans who say they look 'miserable'
text:
They announced the sex of their baby at a lavish gender reveal party on Sunday.

And now MAFS star Cyrell Paule, 30, and her Love Island Australia star beau Eden Dally, 27, have hit back at fans who questioned why they looked 'miserable' on such a joyous occasion.

'Everyone having a go because we didn't have a BIG smile in our pic automatically means we aren't thrilled about our baby!' Cyrell sarcastically wrote on Instagram.

Picture perfect? Cyrell Paule (right), 30, and Eden Dally (left), 27, have hit back at fans who said they looked 'miserable' at their gender reveal party on Sunday

'Um, we haven't brushed our teeth. That's why,' she explained of the couple's sour-faced expressions.

On Sunday, Cyrell and Eden hosted their gender reveal party at their home in Sydney's Drummoyne.

At the event, the couple fired off novelty cannons filled with blue smoke.

Wanna see what miserable really looks like? Cyrell (left) memorably lashed out at Martha Kalifatidis (right) on Married At First Sight

Eden, who was not aware of the baby's sex, looked absolutely delighted to learn he was having a boy, crying out that he'd have 'another little Eden'.

Cyrell had already learned of the child's sex several weeks ago, but wanted to surprise her boyfriend with the news.

At the invite-only shindig guests indulged in donuts and other sweet treats, while Cyrell sipped on a non-alcoholic, fruity drink.

Sweet treats! The pair posed with pink and blue balloons, as well as cakes and sweets in the same tones

Guests on the day included MAFS co-stars Jules Robinson, 37, Cameron Merchant, 35, as well as Mick Gould, 32.

Cyrell first announced her pregnancy in August, telling New Idea the news came as a surprise as she and Eden weren't planning a baby.

At the time, the couple expressed concerns that some people would dismiss their child as a 'publicity stunt'.
description: They just announced the sex of their baby at a lavish gender reveal party.
authors: Shannon Shipley For Daily Mail Australia
